summary: This document is an email chain from July 2020 discussing former President Bill Clinton's alleged travel to Jeffrey Epstein's island. The primary email, from Andy Kay, questions why Clinton has not been interviewed or charged in relation to Epstein.

persons.name: Andy Kay
persons.context: Author of the primary email questioning why former President Bill Clinton has not been interviewed or charged regarding trips to Jeffrey Epstein's island.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Subject of the email inquiry, which alleges he made 32 plane trips to Jeffrey Epstein's island and questions why he has not been interviewed or charged.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the owner of the island to which Bill Clinton allegedly traveled.

connections.description: Email alleges Bill Clinton made 32 plane trips to Jeffrey Epstein's island, implying a social or travel connection.

events.title: Email inquiry about Bill Clinton and Epstein
events.description: Andy Kay sends an email questioning why former President Bill Clinton has not been interviewed or charged regarding alleged trips to Jeffrey Epstein's island.

keyFacts: An email from Andy Kay, dated July 2, 2020, claims former President Bill Clinton made 32 plane trips to Jeffrey Epstein's island.
The email directly questions why Bill Clinton has not been interviewed or charged in relation to the Epstein case.
The document is part of a forwarded email chain, indicating the information was being circulated among parties in July 2020.
